core_combat.description: Rules and mechanics for resolving personal combat in White Star.
round_structure: Next highest acts, continuing until all have acted
Repeat in the same order until combat ends

initiative.simultaneous_rule: Ties result in simultaneous actions; damage still applies even if attacker dies

attack_roll.mechanic: Roll 1d20 + BHB + bonuses (STR or DEX, tech, etc.)

melee_attack.bonuses: STR To-Hit and STR damage bonus if Referee allows

missile_attack.modifiers: -2 To-Hit per range tier beyond short (e.g., -6 at extreme)

visibility.special_senses: Referee determines if powerful creatures detect invisibility

movement.normal: Move up to Movement (typically 12 = 120 ft) and act
movement.running: Move up to 2x Movement, but no other actions allowed

gifts_and_meditations.activation: Begin of round; fails if user takes damage before activation

negotiation.option: Players may attempt to resolve or delay combat via dialogue

morale.rule: Most enemies flee if hopeless; Referee may use Saving Throw

damage_and_death.rule: HP loss reduces total; 0 HP = death

healing.rest: 1 HP/day of rest, full HP after 4 weeks of rest

time.notes: A round is used for combat and fast-paced actions. A turn is used for slower exploration activities. The Referee may also rule that longer spans of time (hours, days, or months) pass depending on the context.
